Articles.Content:
Hey, I just created this thread for you to share your own interplanetary ship designs.

Here's mine, the Duna-one (guess where it's going)

It consists of 4 seperate ships right now, I will probably add more fuel though.

Now show of yours!!
Well... I did have a 900 part mother ship in .20 but I never got a picture of It

I've recently posted this 530-part, 13-launches-assembly beauty:

Unfortunately, the thread didn't generate much response. Perhaps a tad complicated, or it got buried too fast for people to see. Shame, I invested quite a bit of time on it...

Rune. Or you know, might be I just have a weird aesthetic taste, 'cause I like it a lot.

...it totally worked, just couldn't make it back from Eve.

But seriously, folks, here's my good one:

It was assembled in orbit over the course of... I think six missions or so, consists of some 650-odd parts weighing over 100 tons total, and includes science facilities (this was before 0.23), private quarters, and escape pods for all crew members - because I care about my Kerbals and want them to be comfortable and not die if something bad happens.

Edited January 28, 2014 by parameciumkid
